author: danj
msg: Reverting to the original implementation of WS-RMD exposure, via WS-MEx - creating metadata resource types
in a descriptor and providing the RMD WSDL was a pain but could probably be hidden with tooling. The persistence
of RMD metadata resources, though, would require another component that could reset all of the resource-to-metadata-resource
mappings after both had be reloaded at initialzation. That means that users wishing to expose metadata resoruces
would have to add THREE extra items - the ResourceMetadata capability, the metadata resource type, and this
third controller/factory resource type. This is just too much. We can return the same descriptor via WS-MEx,
and the client API will remain the same.

author: danj
msg: Added an init param for <resource-type> that are WSRF WsResources - name is 'validate-wsrp-schema' and it
allows users to shut off WSRP schema validation. Default value is 'true'.

author: dennisl
msg: o Initialize plexus component in the correct way.

author: danj
msg: Added WS-SG persistence layer based on the generic persistence framework in muse-core. This sytem relies
on the fact that SG entries are reloaded before SG resources, and then the reloading of the SG entry table
is done by finding the reloaded entries by EPR and filling in the rest of the properties (member EPR, SG EPR,
etc.) using data saved to a file. The ServiceGroupPersistence interface extends Persistence to make sure that
the layer can respond to events that are inherent to SG implementation (creation/destruction of resources).

author: danj
msg: Changed names of WSRF ext faults to be inline with other WSRF fault names.
